abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Hubei Xiaogan
            Xiangfan Highway project is to prod economic development,
            and trade in Hubei province, by improving its transport
            links. The increased transport capacity in the
            Xiaogan-Xiangfan corridor, while improving accessibility in
            low income areas, will nonetheless affect populations due to
            necessary reallocation needs. Thus, engineering designs will
            follow four basic principles: 1) avoid construction in areas
            close to towns, villages, schools, hospitals, factories, and
            mining areas; 2) avoid cultural heritage sites; 3) avoid
            cultivated, and ore deposits areas; and, 4) minimize
            disturbance to basic infrastructure. This resettlement
            action plan (RAP), based on public participation, looks at
            the activities to be carried following consultation with
            project affected people (PAP), and, assesses compensation as
            follows. The RAP aims at improving, or at least restore,
            living conditions of PAPs, and, stipulates that material
            losses will be compensated at replacement costs, with equal
            treatment in the absence of property ownership, rather
            providing help for recovery, and compensation on assets
            lost. Land compensation will be based at six times the
            annual average output value, per cultivated land unit, for a
            period of three years, while crop compensation shall be
            based on the classification of cultivated land levied.
            Grievance mechanisms include complaints and appeals at
            county/district levels, and the right to present lawsuits to
            civil courts. Volume II provides the policy framework for
            resettlement, and land acquisition.
